item.title: Investigators ask the South Korean MP to accuse the deposit leader
item.description: South Korea's anti-corruption office recommended yesterday to the Public Prosecution Service that the deposed president, Yoon Suk-Youol, is accused of rebellion and abuse of power by declaring martial law in December. The Senior Officials Corruption Investigation Office (CIO) announced that it has transferred the case to the Public Prosecutor's Office, which has the power to formally charge a South Korean head of state. Cio considers that Yoon conspired with then-National Defense Minister Kim Yong-Hyun and other military officers to start a riot, declaring martial law on the night of December 3. It argues, moreover, that Yoon has abused power by sending troops to the National Assembly (Parliament) to prevent deputies from revoking martial law. The Public Prosecutor's Office now has 11 days to decide whether or not to initiate the requested process. If Yoon is found guilty of leading an insurrection, a crime for which a president does not have immunity in the country, he could be sentenced to life in prison or the death penalty. Yoon is in custody at the Seoul Detention Center in Uiwang, south of Seoul, since January 15. The Constitutional Court is simultaneously made a judgment to determine whether or not to ratify the dismissal approved by parliamentarians on December 14. If the highest court in South Korea confirms the impeachment, early presidential elections have to be called within 60 days after the court decision. Yoon refuses to witness in the investigation into the alleged crime of rebellion. Yoon Suk-Youol surprised the country on December 3 by declaring martial law, a measure reminiscent of black days of the South Korean military dictatorship and that justified with the intention of protecting the country from “North Korean Communist forces” and “Eliminate elements hostile to the state”. Pressured by deputies and thousands of protesters, Yoon was forced to revoke the decision hours later.

item.title: Hospitality | More than 14.4 million guests in 2024
item.description:
Last year, Macao hotels hosted more than 14.4 million people, with the average occupancy rate of rooms reaching 86.4 percent, an annual climb of almost 5 percent. Room prices in 5-star hotels rose 2.8 percent, with the average spell fixed at 1,585 patacas
The Directorate of Statistics and Census Services (DSEC) yesterday revealed that last year the hotel establishments of Macau hosted about 14,433,000 people, totaling a 6.4 percent increase with 2023. Statistical data show the significant climb of international customers, which totaled more than 1.1 million, with an annual growth of 57.4 percent. In this chapter highlight to guests from the Republic of Korea, who duplicated annually, and reached the 321 thousand. Also the number of guests of Malaysia (87,000), Japan (81,000), India (73,000) and Singapore (68,000) ascended 53.4, 49.1, 97.2 and 24.1 percent respectively. From a more operational perspective, in 2024 the industry registered an average occupancy rate of 86.4 percent guest rooms, plus 4.9 percentage points compared to 2023. The 5 -star hotels were the ones that recorded the highest occupancy rates Rooms (88.6 percent), with a rise of 6.1 percent. Sides of the medal During 2024, the average price of the five -star hotel rooms was 1,585 patacas, an increase of 2.8 percent compared to 2023, second data from the Macao Hotel Association, cited by the Tourism Services Directorate. The data reveal that last year's prices were only 0.6 percent below the 2019 registration The month of December exceeded the average prices practiced throughout 2024, with the average price in 4 and 5 star hotels reaching 1,624 patacas, yet a decrease of 8.1 percent compared to December 2023. Highlight for Last month that completed six consecutive months of homologous prices falls, a descent that began in July. At the end of last year there were 146 hotel establishments that provided public accommodation services (+4, compared to the end of the year 2023), providing a total of 43,000 rooms of guests (-7.8 percent).

item.title: Traffic | Accidents and fines soar in 2024
item.description:
Last year closed with more than 15,500 road accidents, an annual rise of 14 percent. Despite the increase of injured, exceeding 5,300, the road deaths decreased to five. By 2024, authorities investigated nearly 190 million patacas in fines, plus 9.12 percent, although the offenses only rose 0.4 percent
More accidents on the roads, more patacas in fines and fewer deaths in road accidents. This is how 2024 can be summarized, according to statistical data released by the Public Security Police Corps (CPSP). Last year, Macau's roads and streets recorded 15,510 road accidents, a total that represented an annual increase of 14.36 percent compared to 2023. Even so, 2024 was less deadly on the territory's roads, with five fatalities (all relating to drivers) compared to eight deaths recorded in 2023, i.e. a decrease of 37.5 percent. However, the number of injured increased by almost 13 percent, to a total of 5,341, an increase driven by the increase in minor injuries in a year in which the number of injuries requiring hospital admission fell by almost 50 percent. Also in the chapter of the claim, highlighting the increase of accidents involving pedestrians, with the annual climb of 6.7 percent to a total of 510 occurrences. Economic diversification The year 2024 was also a period when the amount of fines added almost 16 million patacas compared to the previous year. Last year, the total amount of the fines was almost 189.8 million patacas, a 9.12 percent increase compared to the same period. Despite the increase in the amount ease by the authorities, the infractions to the road traffic law and the road code kept practically the same level, with a slight rise of 0.4 percent to 703.8 thousand occurrences. In the chapter of fines, the parking lot continued to dominate, with 618,260 fines, the very broad majority for illegal parking on public roads. Still, parking fines decreased by 2.38 percent compared to 2023. However, the number of blocked vehicles increased by 24.5 percent by 2024 for a total of 2,226. On the opposite side, data from 2024 from the CPSP reveal the return of a classic, with an increase of almost 48 percent in irregularities committed by taxi drivers to a total of 870 cases. In relation to drivers caught driving under the influence of alcohol, authorities counted 170 people drunk at the wheel, an annual increase of almost 7 percent. Of these 170 people, 155 were male. One of the statistics that has increased in recent times in terms of fines is pedestrians who cross the road without complying with traffic rules. Last year, authorities fined 7,460 pedestrians, a total that represented an increase of 58.5 percent.

item.title: Lunar New Year | Decisive holidays for analyzing expenses beyond gambling
item.description:
Professor at the University of Macao and tourism specialist Glenn McCartney considers that holidays associated with Chinese New Year will be essential to realize the size of regional tourism and game -related expenses
The Lunar New Year of the Snake begins next Wednesday and, once again, opens a period of holidays that will bring many tourists to Macau. According to assistant professor at the University of Macau (UM) Glenn Mccartney, holidays associated with Chinese New Year will be important to “measure and evaluate non-gaming interest and expenditure, as well as the numbers of regional visits, given the investment in city-wide events and the expected large number of visitors,” he told HM. “From a business point of view, the fundamental question is how the number of visitors translates into effective expenses and the impact that this brings to small and medium -sized companies, such as restaurants, bars and shops, whether they are visitors who get overnight or of tour who returned to Hong Kong or Zhuhai the same day. ” Therefore, “there are expectations that the occupancy rate of Macau hotels will be high, and there will be some day visitors who will return to stay in Zhuhai”, he estimated. More than one million Since in the same year's same year, the territory received almost 1.4 million tourists during the 8 -day Chinese New Year, it is expected for the coming days “a high number of visitors”, “like this year The Chinese New Year begins on January 29, Macau may benefit from the increase in the number of tourists in the previous and later weekends. ” But Glenn Mccartney also highlights other factors that can boost tourism numbers, “as we have seen greater accessibility and ease of crossing borders as an important factor since the reopening after Covid, for example, with the increase in visitors from Hong Kong across the bridge.” Glenn McCartney also argues that resort promotional actions and streets festivities can also attract tourists, and an important feature of Chinese New Year's activities is the 'feedback' component, "residents and visitors could give Your opinion, allowing the authorities to realize the impact of these Chinese New Year's activities. ” “This type of feedback can be a valuable source for improving various aspects of the organization, operations and marketing of Chinese New Year events in order to analyze current and potential future visitors. The use of networks can be part of the evaluation of the impact analysis of Chinese New Year promotions”, he described. For these days Helena de Senna Fernandes, director of tourism services, said she expects a daily average of 185,000 visitors, of which only eight thousand should be international. The main attraction during this period in Macau will be the Lunar New Year's stop, held on January 31 and repeated on February 8.

item.title: Press | Sam Hou Fai highlights diversity and internationalization
item.description:

The Chief Executive, Sam Hou Fai, considered that the Portuguese and English Language Communication bodies play a link in connection with the international community. The message was left during the traditional dinner offered to the media. According to the Social Communication Office, Sam Hou Fai stated that “Portuguese and English language media is an important example of Macao's cultural diversity and internationalization”. The government leader said they hoped these bodies “also proceed with the good performance of the international link, enhancing the advantages of linguistic, cultural and international ties, continuing to exterior to Macao's uniqueness, resulting from the fusion of oriental and western cultures. ”. With this hope, the government leader believes that the media bodies contribute to "raising the role of Macao as a platform between China and Portuguese -speaking countries, as well as a higher -level opening platform." The chief executive also said he hoped that "the sector will continue to increase its development and to promote, along with the government, internationalization, so that Macao is more attractive and has a greater global influence." As such, Sam Hou Fai expects to transmit “abroad, through professional reports, the 'Macao Experiences' and the 'Wisdom of China', favoring better clarification and avoiding misunderstandings and bad interpretations of the foreigner, thus making the field in an important window of objective, rational and genuine exchange of oriental and western cultures ”. Protected freedoms In the hopes expressed at dinner with representatives of the media, Sam also asked for oversight of “government action”. Looking ahead to the year 2024, Sam Hou Fai made a positive assessment of the media's actions, indicating that “they played the important role of linking with the Portuguese and English communities abroad in accessing information about Macau”. Furthermore, he indicated that they “made good use of the unique advantages of the region, resulting from its proximity to Mainland China and its openness to the world” and made “the reality and development of Macau known and provided first-hand information to the public about the successful implementation of the one country, two systems principle.” The government leader also indicated that “freedom of the press is fully guaranteed by the Basic Law and the Macao SAR Press Law, which is why it will be safeguarded, as always and in accordance with the law, by the Macao SAR Government, which will support the sector in the correct fulfillment of its duties, in news coverage and access to news, actively collaborating in the efficient exchange of information between the various public services and the sector”.

item.title: Afghanistan | Beijing calls for severe punishment for perpetrators of murder of Chinese citizen
item.description: China yesterday called on the Afghan authorities to carry out a “thorough investigation” and “severely punish” those responsible for the murder, on Wednesday, of a Chinese citizen who worked in a gold mine in the Afghan province of Takhar. Chinese Foreign Ministry spokeswoman Mao Ning said yesterday at a press conference that Beijing is “deeply shocked” with the attack. "China is against all forms of terrorism," said the spokesman, appealing to the "repression of the Islamic State and other terrorist organizations listed by the UN Security Council." "China will continue to pay close attention to the security situation in Afghanistan and to support Afghan authorities in combating all forms of terrorist violence and maintaining security and stability in the country," Mao added, urging the Afghan government to Take the necessary measures "to ensure the safety of citizens and Chinese organizations in the country." According to local police, the victim worked in a gold mine in the region, which borders Tajikistan. A local branch of the Islamic State group claimed responsibility for the attack. China is one of the few international actors that has maintained diplomatic relations with Afghanistan since the Taliban came to power in August 2021. The two countries share a small international border of just 76 kilometers in the easternmost part of the so-called Wajan Corridor, a remote pass in the Pamir mountain range. Chinese companies, with support from Beijing, have sought to seize opportunities to exploit Afghanistan's vast deposits of undeveloped resources, especially the Mes Aynak mine, which is believed to contain the world's largest copper deposit.

In Dantu, one of the three districts of Zhenjiang (Jiangsu) where he lived more than four decades, his memory is celebrated in a unique park in the country where one can observe a thousand and three hundred copies of stone -caligrah recordings. She is “the serpent that comes out of the hole” (Kwok, 1997, 67). It belongs to the time period between 9 am and 11 am. The serpent is the strongest sexual symbol and, therefore, in Indian yogic philosophies of the tantric line, which extend throughout Asia and, in particular, Southeast Asia, it is kundalini, as C.G. pointed out. Jung in The Psychology of Kundalini Yoga. Notes to a Seminar Given in 1932. How do Chinese related to the serpent's life force? At first they were quite spontaneous, they had an animist philosophy that evolved into popular Taoism, but it must not be forgotten that also from an early age, from Confucius and the establishment of Confucianism, and in a systematic way since Han, has had In this culture a great determination to control the natural energies. This trend has redoubled the acceptance of Buddhist philosophy, initially far from the natural and tantric experiences. During the times of the last Qing dynasty, religious experiences linked to Buddhism intensified and, as such, the conflict between natural and spiritual forces became manifest, opening a war similar to that seen in Christianity, with Eve and Adam fighting. being expelled from Paradise because of a supposedly infamous serpent. The open war between natural forces and formal religion would still be recorded in Chinese literature, in one of the most poignant love stories, entitled The White Serpent (《白蛇传》Bái Shé Zhuàn), also known by the name of its protagonists Xu Xian (许仙Xǔ Xiān) and Bai Niangzi(白娘子Bái Niángzi), which reached its peak of popularity during the Qing dynasty. In it lovers are hopelessly persecuted by a Buddhist Bonzo, who destroys their happiness by insisting that Xu Xian (许仙) move away from Bai Niangzi (白娘子), as she was an enchanted serpent. Omitted by Bonzo would be the meditation effort that led the serpent to transfigure itself in human form. What Bonzo Buddhist has not seen, as many Christian religious cannot see, is that on the outside of what seems to be transgression if it hides a natural and spontaneous force closely linked to the minds of those who deal with it. For a pure mind, the natural force has nothing impure, to a blurred mind, the force is, in the western version, sin, and in the eastern negative and demonic power. The serpent's strength is complete in itself. There is nothing to add to it. Attesting to its perfect completeness, there is a much-told proverbial story, Drawing the Serpent's Feet (畫/画蛇添足Huà Shé Tiān Zú), often shortened into the expression The Serpent's Feet (Shé Zú蛇足). 古时候 ， 楚国有一家人 ， 祭完祖之后 ， 准备将祭祀用的一壶酒 ， 赏给帮忙办事的人喝。帮忙办事的人很多 ， ， 若是让一个 若是让一个人喝 ， 那能喝得有余。这一壶酒到底怎么分呢？大家都安静下来 ， 这时有人建议：每个人在地上画一条蛇 ， 谁画得快 ， 这壶酒就归他喝。大家都认为这个方法好 ， 都同意这样做。于是 ， 在地上画起蛇来。 有个人画得很快，一转眼最先画好了，他就端起酒壶要喝酒。但Article他洋洋得意地说：“你们画得好慢啊！我再给蛇画几只脚也不算晚呢！”于是，他便左手提着酒壶，右手给蛇画起脚来。正在他一边给蛇画脚，一边说话的时候，另外一个人已经画好了。那个人马上把酒壶从他手里夺过去，说：“你见过蛇吗？蛇是没有脚的，你为什么要给它添上脚呢:而是我了！”个人说罢就仰起头来，咕咚咕咚把酒喝下去了.” Here's my translation: In ancient times, in the Kingdom Chu (楚國/国 Chǔ Guó), there was a feudal gentleman who, after giving the appropriate ritual libations to the ancestors, still left a jar of wine, which he thought to distribute to his employees. But since these were many, the wine didn't come to everyone, but for one it would be more than enough. After all, how did it be shared? To calm down one of them suggested, "Each one will draw a snake on the floor, which end first, will get the jar of wine." Everyone agreed with the idea and so began to draw. There was one who was full of desire to drink him, so he dispatched the drawing in an open and close eye. Therefore, this said is used to show someone to do something superfluous. When the serpent intends to be different, it has opened the path of metamorphosis, similar to that of the silk bug and butterfly. The Chinese are well aware of the power of the serpent (shé 蛇), whose etymological reading is the worm radically another, the animal, the antithetical force of the civilized. This immense natural energy was renamed as a little dragon (小龙 Xiǎo Lóng) to make room for the reptile to cultivate and exercise on the spiritual way, in an inner body to mind, without, however, losing its telluric roots. item.description: The central Wulin Square (武林门) in Hangzhou was the main market location and until 2005 the terminal pier of the Grand Canal (Da Yunhe, 大运河), where for 1400 years goods from the North, such as furs and coal, were unloaded , and in the opposite direction he broke a lot of cereal and rice. The building in the middle of the square, despite looking like a government site, is the city's exhibition hall. In the western part, two large shopping centers, one of them with a cinema, extend the street along which we are taken to the Grand Canal anchorage. In a small shelter at the entrance to the boarding pier, boat tickets to Suzhou are sold [this is the end of the 90s of the 20th century] and every day a boat leaves from there at half past five in the afternoon, on a journey made overnight by the Jiangnan channel [Jiangnan yunhe (江南运河)]. In the past, the route went to Wuxi, but this service had been disconnected for two years. The Jiangnan channel begins in Zhenjiang, on the south bank of Changjiang (Yangzi or Yangtzé), after the Great Channel crosses the third largest river in the world, and to south follows its course by Danyang (丹阳), Changzhou (常州), Wuxi (无锡), Suzhou (苏州), Pingwang (平望), arriving in Hangzhou where he connects to the Qianantang River. At the counter, which seemed to guard the alley leading to the boarding gate, we bought a small one-bed ticket in a bunk compartment for 98 yuan for the next day, as two-bed cabins cost 115 yuan are sold out. They ask us to arrive at five in the afternoon, half an hour before departure. He looked at the pier from where two years before he had left by boat to Suzhou and returned now prepared to repeat the trip, but when he arrived at the pier I find it being demolished. The boats of these trips are still anchored, but these have now been suspended indefinitely. By chance, we realize the movement registered at the bottom of the pier, with people waiting next to a triangle sign indicating the boat stop. Asking, we found no trip to the former Nanxingqiao (南星桥) boarding pier, situated shortly before reaching the Sanlang Temple, near the Southern Bus Terminal. Now a boat career was open, which on a short ten -minute trip to downstream, touched by brief moments at Baziqiao Zhan (坝子桥站), next to the Bazi Bridge (坝子桥), then returning to the pier where we had party. Also by five Yuan, we are taken to the old gongchen bridge, next to the square of the Great Channel Museum Beijing-Hangzhou. And so we came back to visit this excellent museum, which came to create a new tourist hub in the city of Hangzhou. There are exposed thumbnails of boats, and you can see the paths of maritime travel over the centuries and the centuries of construction of the Great Channel, its sponsors and the way the obstacles presented to make this route a direct connection were resolved between the northern capital and the rest of China. ON THE GREAT CANAL Only with the new opening of the country to tourism in 1978 did interest appear to take new advantage of this great work of engineering. Goods continued to be transported via the Grand Canal, although parts of the route were interrupted, as navigation had been abandoned since the end of the 19th century. In response, in 1981 Wuxi tourism entities opened a trip between Suzhou and Yangzhou and another from Lake Tai to Hangzhou. The boat made available to tourism was a faithful replica of Emperor Sui's dragon boat, Yangdi. In the late 1990s, the trips are between Hangzhou and Suzhou and then to Wuxi the boats are normal two-story passenger boats. Then, in the second or third year after the beginning of the III Millennium, the trip ceased to be made for Wuxi and was only made between Hangzhou and Suzhou and in the year 2007 it was interrupted. We believe, to restructure and prepare new boats for tourists to enjoy the beauties of the landscapes and the history of the great channel. At five in the afternoon we arrived at the pier, half an hour before departure. Fifteen minutes past the hour, at a quarter to six we are sailing through the waters of the Grand Canal. The delay was due to the bicycles of the cycle tourism group having to be packed onto the boat, arriving just before departure time. The boat where we travel has two floors and approximately twenty cabin, with ordinary bathrooms, the kitchen and a small hall, where meals, dinner and breakfast are taken. The trip will be made at night by the region known as Jiangnan [southern Rio], which crosses the lands south of Changjiang (Yangzi River), in the provinces of Zhejiang and Jiangsu, where it comes from the channel built in the qin dynasty with 85 km long and extended in 605. From Hangzhou passes the lands of Huzhou and Jiaxing and leaving Zhejiang's province enters Jiangsu's and surrounding the Tai lake to Suzhou, where by boat will end our trip. From Hangzhou we left for Suzhou, in the comparison of the Venetian traveler Marco Polo, twin cities in terms of beauty, Paradises on Earth. The night falls into Hangzhou when we crossed the Gongzhen Bridge, built in 1631 all of the stone with three arches and that brings us awakened on the deck, despite raining, for starting the non -navigated route. A passenger boat passes by transporting only one person, not being strange because the fog and drizzle all afternoon removes the pleasure of the trip. Choupos lined along the stoned banks are suddenly lit by the red lanterns of a restaurant on the edge of old -style water waiting for customers. The beauty of the landscape may only be due to the shadows of the night. The traffic of boats is intense and all are loaded, some large, where containers, others carrying sand, coal or wooden blasts. The boat with the flat hull and the bow in U, sails the water edge. At the stern of the vessel, at the top of the hinge cabin are the signaling lights, with the green on the right and left side, the red. It leads a focus of intense white light to illuminate the front channel and cross with other vessels deflect it, or go out. The darkness is gaining. Before crossing with other boats, some in the opposite direction, others to be exceeded again, will turn back to seconds the spotlight to warn and view the size of the vessels. Next to a canal diversion, a diesel pump on the bank waits to refill fuel for anyone passing by. The waters carry Styrofoam debris and tree branches. From time to time, a factory on the banks has its pier taking advantage of this privileged transport route to receive raw materials and send production. The width size of the channel varies and sometimes allows the passage at the same time of four boats, but in other places for three is tight. We crossed with a track of boats pulled by a tugger, where the workers' cabins are located, taking tinning ten long container boats. A slight tap our boat makes you feel. We fall asleep, not without first feeling another touch between vessels and this time the blow is stronger. We arrived early in the morning, after more than nine hours of travel navigating the Great Channel. At 5:30, the boat contributed by the Ponte of the Precious Belt (Baodai Qiao, 宝带桥) in the southeast of Suzhou, in the Wuzhong district, but only from him we left at six thirty. Two buses wait on Changqiao Street (长桥街道) to take the passengers to the city center, six kilometers. Baodai qiao is considered one of China's most representative bridges and is named because it was built between 816 and 819 at the expense of selling the valuable belt of Wang Zhongshu, governor of Suzhou in the Tang dynasty. item.title: Death | Rocha Vieira dies at age 85
item.description:
Vasco Rocha Vieira, the last Portuguese Governor of Macau, died yesterday at the age of 85. The general had been ill for a long time. Marcelo Rebelo de Sousa remembered him as “one of the most illustrious officers” of the Army, but, for Macau, Rocha Vieira goes down in history as the great worker behind the measures decided in the 1987 Joint Declaration
It has long been sick, even failing some recent events in Lisbon about Macau and the transition. Vasco Rocha Vieira, General, former Chief of Staff of the Army, and the last Portuguese governor of Macau, died yesterday morning at 85 years old. Born on August 16, 1939, he held the position of Governor of Macao between 1991 and 1999, when the transfer of the territory to China was processed. However, Rocha Vieira already had a connection to Macau, as he was in the territory after April 25. In addition, he was also Minister of the Republic of the Azores between 1986 and 1991. One of the first personalities to react to his death, in Portugal, was the President of the Republic, Marcelo Rebelo de Sousa, who expressed, in an official note, his “deep regret” for the death of Vasco Rocha Vieira, remembering him as “one of the most distinguished officers” of the Army and praising their “marked patriotism”. In a note published on the official website of the Presidency of the Republic on the Internet, the head of State remembers Rocha Vieira as “one of the most illustrious officers of the Portuguese Army in the transition to Democracy and in the first decades of its affirmation”. “Always closely linked to the Commands, he also held political functions such as Minister of the Republic for the Autonomous Region of the Azores”, is recalled in the note. Marcelo Rebelo de Sousa also highlights that Rocha Vieira was “very close to President António Ramalho Eanes”, having been “appointed Chancellor of the Ancient Military Orders” by him. “The symbolism of the moment of transferring the Portuguese administration to the Chinese will remain in the memory of many Portuguese as an example of meaning, meaning of the public cause and marked patriotism,” reads the note of regret. The President of the Republic, who claims to have followed “closely the last months” of Rocha Vieira’s life, “presents to his family, and, in particular, to his widow and children, the testimony of Portugal’s gratitude, with much missed friendship". In his biography, entitled “To all the ports I arrived”, the moment Mário Soares, then President of the Republic, said to Rocha Vieira: “I need yourself. Go to Macao and see if it puts that in order ”, in reference to the case of Macau fax, related to the construction of Macao International Airport, which so many headaches gave its predecessor, Carlos Watermelon, also deceased. The general will then replied that nothing demanded to go to Macau. “I didn't ask you anything, nor did I put it in conditions. I went to Macau with the same spirit with which I went to the Azores. It was not a political position inherent in a career. It was, in fact, a mission, ”he describes. Then it was Rocha Vieira and his team to achieve all objectives and ideal for the future of Macao present in the joint statement that had been signed between Portugal and China in 1987. The government led by Rocha Vieira saw the airport was born, built The entire bilingual legislative framework that is still in place today and raised the Macao Cultural Center, inaugurated by Jorge Sampaio on March 19, 1999, among many other initiatives, including in the area of ​​urbanism. A “great friend” Rocha Vieira, in fact, made the position available at the head of the Macau Executive when Jorge Sampaio was elected President of the Republic, at the turn of 1995 to 1996. “When I went to Macau I didn't know how things were going to go and how long it would take. stay there”, he recalled in his biography. However, despite Sampaio's initial hesitation in making a change, the truth is that Rocha Vieira ended up staying, as “his replacement would affect the regular sequence of the process” of transition, at a time when “the transition was already in sight. of the administration of the territory for China”, is described in “To all the Ports I arrived at”. Speaking to RTP, Chito Rodrigues, a general who was acting governor of Macau, left words of condolence over the death of a friend. “I remember him as a great friend and honorary member of the League of Combatants. He has always had a relationship with us and is a reference for us. We knew it was bad and we were, in a way, not surprised [with the news of death], but it is always an unpleasant surprise.” Chito Rodrigues recalls him in the exercise of his duties in Macau as someone who contributed "to Macau to be a quiet place for decolonization to be done in a" exemplary "way." “I was with him at the opening of the airport and had close relations with him as governor. It was someone who replaced his predecessors successfully and humble, replacing the tradition of military governors in Macao, ”he added. In Fernando Lima and Eduardo Cintra Torres, the former Hong Kong governor, Chris Patten, recalled Rocha Vieira as "a brave and judicious man, with enormous integrity and an excellent server of his country." "I think Portugal was very lucky to have such a good man as the last governor, such a difficult place," he said. The controversies Rocha Vieira's name was, however, involved in some controversies, namely with the creation of the Fundação Jorge Álvares and Fundação Oriente, especially regarding the funds allocated to these two entities. “The bulk of public opinion in the territory and the Beijing authorities contested the legitimacy of a contract under which an entity based in Lisbon was fed with resources generated in Macau”, reads Rocha Vieira’s biography. He only intended for the foundation to “play a useful role for Macau”, and the controversy was diluted over time. On social networks, the journalist and former director of Macau today, João Severino said “mourn a lot” the disappearance of Rocha Vieira. “General Vasco Rocha Vieira left us after several weeks hospitalized at the hospital. Macao's last governor was a good man for many people and discriminatory for many. In any case his military career was exemplary and left marks in the administration of Macao. I kept with the illustrious governor some controversial moments, always within the greatest cordiality and consideration by the maximum representative of my country in Macau. I present to your wife Dr. Leonor and his children my condolences and rest in peace, ”he wrote. An entity that reacted to the disappearance of Rocha Vieira was the Luso-Chinese Chamber of Commerce and Industry (CCILC), which on social networks issued a note of regret about the death of the 138th Portuguese Governor of Macao and chaired to CCILC Strategic Council. “General Rocha Vieira played a remarkable and exemplary role throughout his life, standing out for his commitment to service to the nation, his dedication to relations between Portugal and China, and his historic role in closing the administration cycle Portuguese in Macau.” The same note also states that “in leading the CCILC strategic council, his strategic vision, wisdom and human values ​​have always been a source of inspiration for the entire Board and executive team”. The Lisbon City Council also officially reacted to his disappearance. “Rocha Vieira dedicated his life to defending the national interest, notably serving Portugal as Chief of Staff of the Army and as the last Governor of Macau. A visionary statesman, he ensured a peaceful transfer of Macau's sovereignty to China. A man of courage, he contributed to the consolidation of the democratic process, being a fundamental part of the 25th of November 1975. It was an honor to have his testimony at the first ceremony to commemorate the 25th of November in the Town Hall, in 2023.” Farewell to Macau The images of Rocha Vieira holding the Portuguese flag to his chest on December 19, 1999, with his face visibly moved, are famous, as if saying goodbye to the “mission” he agreed to carry out in Macau. After his role as governor, Rocha Vieira was maintaining narrow ties with the territory, and the last time he was in Macau was in 2023, to receive the distinction of Honoris Causal Doctorate from the Macao University of Science and Technology. Then he stressed that the "good historical relationships" with China are "a trump card for Portugal" and that today the country is "a superpower in affirmation". The general said that “another great asset” for Portugal is interest in China in the Portuguese language, underlining the growing number of Chinese universities that teach Portuguese. At the end of 2020, the coordinator of the Portuguese Language Pedagogical and Scientific Center of the Macao Polytechnic University, Gaspar Zhang Yunfeng, said there were about 50 higher education institutions with Portuguese courses in mainland China. “China is interested in Portuguese developing (…) also to be able to have, through Portugal, a closer relationship with Portuguese-speaking countries”, highlighted Rocha Vieira. In a last interview with Lusa agency in 2019, Rocha Vieira recalled the times in Macau and her vicissitudes, especially regarding the transition process. “I had more problems with the Portuguese part than with the Chinese part (…) often, for lack of perception. Normally, people are far away in Lisbon - this is a historical thing, which is not just now - and think they know the solutions better than those in Macao, ”he said. Rocha Vieira assured that, when it was necessary to define “the direction, the fundamental objectives of the policies for Macau, they were discussed by the Government of Macau, in Lisbon, with whom they should be discussed, with the President of the Republic and the Prime Minister”, there was “always” about this “a great understanding on the part of the Portuguese sovereign bodies and a great proof of trust in relation to those who were in the territory”.

item.title: USA | Trump says tariffs are “the only way” the country can be “treated properly”
item.description: European countries will be subject to customs tariffs, "the only form" of the United States "to be treated as they should be," US President Donald Trump said Tuesday. “The European Union (EU) is very bad for us. They treat us very badly. They do not accept our cars or our agricultural products. In fact, they don’t accept much,” said the President of the United States, adding that, therefore, they will be targets of tariffs. Questioned by the press at the White House, Trump also assured that his administration is discussing “10 percent tariffs on Chinese products, because they send [the opioid] fentanyl to Mexico and Canada”, which ends up being consumed in the United States. United. "It is probably for February 1," added Donald Trump, which corresponds to the date announced the day before for the application of 25 percent tariffs on Mexican and Canadian products. China reacted yesterday, claiming to be "firmly determined" to "defend their national interests." "We have always believed that there are no winners in a trade war or a tariff war," said Mao Ning, spokesman for the Chinese Foreign Ministry at a press conference. The president of the European Commission (EC), Ursula Von der Leyen, who participated in the Davos Economic Forum, Switzerland, on Tuesday, ensured that Europe is ready to talk to the United States government, remembering that Washington is a important commercial partner. Our first priority is to quickly start conversations about our common interests and be ready to negotiate, ”he said:“ We will be pragmatic, but we will keep firm in our principles: to defend our interests and respect our values, ”he said the European leader. "Europe will continue to defend cooperation, not only with our longtime friends (…) but also with all the countries with which we have common interests," added von der Leyen. “Our message to the rest of the world is simple: we are ready to dialogue with you, if this can lead to mutual benefits”, he added, ensuring that he intends to “deepen” relations between Brussels and Beijing. Nothing new During his presidential campaign, Trump had already denounced the United States' trade deficit in relation to the EU, comparing the bloc to “a little China” and accusing it of taking advantage of the world's leading economic power. "We have a commercial deficit with the EU of $ 350 billion," he insisted on Tuesday, noting that "China is aggressive, but it is not only China, other countries are also big aggressors." The US trade deficit with the EU will amount to $131 billion in 2023, according to data from the White House Trade Representative (USTR), and is mainly concentrated in four countries: Germany, France, Ireland and Italy. Before being re-elected, Donald Trump had already threatened the EU with the imposition of customs duties on European products unless the bloc increased its purchases of American oil and gas. The European Commissioner for the Economy, Valdis Dombrovskis, guaranteed on Monday, after Trump's inauguration, that the EU is “ready to defend its economic interests,” as it has done “during the first Trump administration when it introduced tariffs on steel and aluminum ”.

item.title: Death / Rocha Vieira: Macau remembers last Portuguese Governor
item.description: Macao's last governor, Vasco Rocha Vieira, who died at age 85, launched the foundations of the success of the Chinese region and defended the rights of civil servants, although with "some mismatches," local leaders told Lusa. Vasco Rocha Vieira, former army's head of the army between 1976 and 1978, died in the early hours of Monday at the age of 85, confirmed to the Portuguese official source of that military industry. “He is an illustrious figure, fundamental in the history of Macau’s transition, but also, to a certain extent, in the present and the future,” said José Sales Marques, president of Leal Senado, the former city council, between 1993 and 1999. “There is a lot something that was done during that period and that continues today. The bases of the Macau Special Administrative Region also have a lot to do with the work of Lieutenant General Rocha Vieira”, argued Sales Marques. Rocha Vieira served as governor of Macau between 1991 and 1999, when the territory was transferred to China. It was during his mandate that the construction of the city's airport was completed. The Macao that Rocha Vieira found and the one that left “does not compare. What has been done in those years is all anything that history has already recorded, ”said Sales Marques. also a member of the then Advisory Board of Rocha Vieira. Former Deputy António NG Kuok Cheong told Lusa that, despite the distrust of the Chinese, the administration "tried to do something to encourage the city's economic growth, which was very poor at that time, before returning Macao." António NG, elected to the Legislative Assembly five months after the appointment of Rocha Vieira, stressed that the main obstacle was China's resistance to the liberalization of the game sector, which would only be released in 2002. Something that forced the Portuguese administration to sell land to finance infrastructure projects, inadvertently planting the roots of the housing problem that Macau currently faces, he said. “They tried to sell the land openly, but the Chinese government prevented them. Thus, most land was sold to powerful people in China for a very low price, because Macau's economy was very weak, ”said NG. A class of landlords was created who, after Macao became the world capital of casinos, enriched by controlling the offer and maintaining the housing prices high, lamented the former deputy. Work in civil servants Jorge Fão, one of the founders of the Macao Public Function Workers Association (ATFMP) in 1987, noted that Rocha Vieira “fulfilled the mission as governor” and “dignified her country”. The former president of ATFPM, ahead of the association "for over ten years", told Lusa that he was "unionist before being a politician" and "had some mismatches" with the lieutenant general. Fão explained that he was “one of the protagonists” who worked so that, after Macau’s transition to China, “public servants [of the Portuguese administration] were entitled to a pension” paid by Portugal. “No official from the other colonies had the right (…) When there was talk of discussing the handover of Macau to China, we were very worried. We launched our union struggles and had several meetings with the governance of Portugal and Macau (…). We had some meetings and in those meetings we also had disagreements”, he recalled. In the end, summarized the current president of the General Assembly of the Association of Retirees, Reformed and Pensioners of Macao, "the outcome was not bad." "Everyone must be satisfied, too, I who had part of this fight and live in this pension for over 30 years," he said. At the time of administration, there were around 3,600 retirees with pensions transferred to Portugal, he concluded. In 2022, Jorge Fão told Lusa that he believed that around two thousand retirees from the former Portuguese administration of Macau lived in the Chinese region. PS praises life “entirely dedicated to the service of Portugal” The PS expressed regret at the death of the last Portuguese governor of Macau, praising a life “entirely dedicated to the service of Portugal” of a “prestigious soldier” and one of the “best interpreters of the importance of Macau”. Through a statement, the party led by Pedro Nuno Santos mourns the death of Vasco Rocha Vieira, “prestigious soldier and last Governor of Macau under Portuguese administration”. “His life was entirely dedicated to the service of Portugal, both in his military career and in the political participation after April 25, as a member of the Revolution Council (by inherence of duties as Chief of Staff of the Army), Minister of the Republic in the Azores, assistant secretary of the government of Macao and governor of Macao, ”says the same note. Stating that “his life was forever linked to Macau”, for the PS this “was one of the best interpreters of the importance” of that territory “for the relationship between Portugal and the Popular Republic of China”, as well as the uniqueness of the now region Special Administrative. “The last years of the Portuguese administration of the Territory of Macau, under the leadership of General Rocha Vieira, are marked by the completion of several important public infrastructure works to support the subsequent development of Macau, as well as administrative reforms to prepare it for the subsequent period”, he praises. Socialists also refer to the ceremony transferring sovereignty from the Territory of Macau to the People's Republic of China, in which the way in which Rocha Vieira “personified and symbolized the dignity and tribute to the Portuguese presence in Macau for centuries” was undeniable. "And marked the friendship and respect that the Portuguese maintain with Macao and the Popular Republic of China, and which allows, after 25 years of transition, to preserve the uniqueness of Macao that remains a meeting point between cultures," He added. The PS thus gives "public note of its deep respect for services to the country" and "addresses to your family and your friends your most felt condolences." Words by Eanes Already the former President of the Republic Ramalho Eanes classified Rocha Vieira as “a man of exception” and “one of the best” among the greatest figures in Portugal. “General Rocha Vieira was an exceptional man for his excellent actions and assumed social responsibility, deserving to be, rightly, considered ‘one of the best of our greatest’”, wrote António Ramalho Eanes in a note sent to the Lusa agency. The first head of state elected of Portuguese democracy remembers Vasco Rocha Vieira as "an extraordinary man," especially "at three levels: for his distinctive personality, for his relevant military performance and for the country's services at the country." On a personal level, Eanes considers that Rocha Vieira, who died today at the age of 85, “possessed superior qualities of spirit”, had “exceptional intelligence”, “a good temperament” and “had a strong personality”. At the military level, “he was one of the most distinct military of his generation, providing the army to the relevant services, in difficult times, namely, in the scent of the political regime prior to April 25, during the 25th of April and even, even, On November 25, having also played an important role as a representative of the Portuguese Armed Forces with NATO ”. Regarding the political level, Eanes concludes that Rocha Vieira had an activity of “great quality and great importance for the country, whether as minister of the Republic for the Azores, or even as governor of Macau, putting all his commitment into the design and execution , successfully, in a policy of successful transformation of Macau, also participating, with the success that is known, in the transfer of the administration of the territory of Macau to the People's Republic of China”. Souvenirs from the Azores The president of the Azorean parliament, Luís Garcia, also expressed regret at the death of Vasco Rocha Vieira, recalling his “exemplary dedication to the public cause” and his “invaluable contribution” to the country and the Azores. “Throughout his notable military and political career, Rocha Vieira revealed an unshakable sense of State, exemplary dedication to the public cause and a deep patriotism, which indelibly marked his service to Portugal”, states Luís Garcia in a note of condolence. The President of the Legislative Assembly of the Autonomous Region of the Azores (Alraa) states that he became aware of the death of the Lieutenant General, a "odd figure and one of the most illustrious officers of the Portuguese army", with "deep dismay." According to the note, Luís Garcia “expresses his deepest condolences to the bereaved family, leaving a deep testimony of gratitude for their invaluable contribution to the country and the Azores”. "As Minister of the Republic for the Autonomous Region of the Azores, between 1986 and 1991, Vasco Rocha Vieira performed his duties with high commitment, contributing significantly to the strengthening of institutional relations and the valorization of regional autonomy," he says. Alraa's leader also points out that the period when Rocha Vieira was at the service of the Azores "is remembered as a time of dedication to dialogue and the construction of bridges between the national sovereignty organs and the region's own government agencies." “He will also be remembered for the symbolism of his action as the last Governor of Macau, a position he held between 1991 and 1999, when he led the transfer of the Portuguese administration to the Chinese one, in an example of a sense of responsibility and loyalty to public service that will be recorded in the collective memory of Portugal”, he concluded. Portuguese PM manifests itself Prime Minister Luís Montenegro today recalled Rocha Vieira as “one of the most brilliant military personnel to body the patriotic sense of being Portuguese”, highlighting his “historical and striking and macau” connection. Lieutenant General Vasco Rocha Vieira, the last Portuguese governor of Macao and former army general head of the state, died today at dawn at the age of 85, confirmed to the Portuguese official source of that military industry. “General Vasco Rocha Vieira was one of the brightest military personnel to give body to the patriotic sense of being Portuguese, with special services in the consolidation of our democracy and in the historical and striking connection to Macao, where he was the last governor,” wrote Luís Montenegro, in a publication on the social network X. The prime minister also presented condolences to family and friends and said he kept Rocha Vieira "gestures of kindness and words of civic and political responsibility."

item.title: Toponymy | Study links streets with Portuguese names to colonialism
item.description:
In the master's dissertation “Sino-Portuguese Culture in Macau-History on the Streets”, Zhao Zhen argues that the Portuguese administration diluted “the national identity” of the Chinese population, by putting names with reference to Portugal on the streets, namely writers, navigators, governors and civil servants
Zhao Zhen, author of the master's dissertation “Sino-Portuguese Culture in Macao-Street History and Sino-Portuguese Culture from the perspective of the names of the streets of Macau)”, argues that the choice of street names with reference to Portugal during Portugal The years of the Portuguese administration was an effective form of colonization and the creation of the feeling of belonging to the colonizing nation, especially with regard to the Chinese community. In the dissertation, defended at the University of Trás-os-Montes and Alto Douro (UTAD), it is concluded that “before the return of Macau to China, the Portuguese Government carried out a political and cultural practice through the attribution of street names to the Portuguese way”. Thus, the names of the streets of Macao served “as a means of transmitting a collective memory, starting with the construction of the Portuguese government's image in Macau and the guidance of its main values”, using “iconic historical figures and events to reinforce the identification of the colonized with their colonizing identity ”. Zhao Zhen further added that “during the 400 years of colonization of Macau by the Portuguese State, linguistic symbols were applied to the inhabitants of Macau through the naming of streets, diluting the traditional national identity of the Chinese and implanting that of the colonizers, thus achieving the objective of remodeling the national identity of local inhabitants”. For the author of the study, the issue of the territory's very particular toponymy had consequences with regard to national identity. “The street names in Macau are different from those in other Chinese cities, and this has had an impact on the cultural identity of the local population, who grew up with Chinese and Portuguese history and culture and who do not have a strong sense of cultural identity. It thus dilutes its mission of transmitting its national culture.” A form of domain Admittedly, Zhao Zhen's academic work in the area of ​​Culture Sciences draws attention to the fact that Macau's toponymy reflects a mixture of cultures. However, the author goes further, analyzing how many streets there are in Portuguese and Chinese with names of important personalities, highlighting the fact that Portuguese culture is dominant. The fact that there are streets in Macau named after Portuguese soldiers, former governors or politicians, such as Mário Soares, Sidónio Pais or Ramalho Eanes, is seen as synonymous with the fact that the Portuguese invested in “an effective process” of transmitting “a materialized vision of the world that influences and transmits social relations between people and different social classes”. Thus, what occurred was “an act that does not use violence as a form of forced control of the minds and conscience of the population”, in which “a means of coercion” was not applied. Zhao Zhen states that "in total there are 26 streets named after Portuguese government officials in Macao who were distinguished by the contribution they made to the city, with no street with the name of a Chinese employee in Macao." This shows “the distinction made by the Portuguese colonizers as a ruling class and the Chinese as a dominated class” is indicated. However, the author points out that “the Portuguese colonization of Macao was not an absolute aggression or dominion”, because “the colonizers tried to achieve leadership from a variety of perspectives, including ideological”, in which “the process of achieving this leadership It was interspersed with a more complex racial and cultural existence. ” According to the author, “the first systematic delimitation of streets and the establishment of names by the Portuguese government of Macao was in 1869”, and were used enough names with connection to the discoveries and the former Portuguese empire. Zhao Zhen gives the example of Rua de João de Almeida, which “is named after a general who stood out in campaigns to assert colonial power in Angola, Africa, at the beginning of the 20th century”. In total, there are 26 streets with references to the discoveries and former Portuguese navigators, showing that “the colonial administration [Portuguese] used external political forces to indoctrinate the inhabitants of Macao with the intention of achieving leadership, guiding society through manipulation spiritual, moral and cultural ”. In addition, the author considers that it was used "a colonial vocabulary to create a sense of identity and subordination among the inhabitants, in order to achieve permanent colonization." Highlight is the existence of nine streets in Macau named after Macanese, such as Rua Francisco H. Fernandes, who was born in the territory on February 13, 1863, son of Portuguese parents, and who was a close friend of Sun Yat -sen, father of the Republican Revolution in China, in 1911. The place of the Chinese The same dissertation reads that, in contrast to the primacy of references to Portuguese culture and history, there are only 12 streets in Macau “named after Chinese”, the majority of which “were merchants from the peninsula and all had connections with the Portuguese government in the region”. In turn, “Dr. Sun Yat-sen Avenue is the only street named after a Chinese political figure”. Citing another academic, surnamed Kuan, Zhao Zhen states that “in the case of names named after Chinese celebrities, in addition to being inferior in number, they were non-political figures”. “The Portuguese Government of Macau, when naming public roads, intentionally took political factors into account, wanting to convey the message that Macau was under Portuguese rule and that, politically speaking, it was a Portuguese colony”, said this same academic. Highlights include two streets named after Macau's return to China, namely Avenida Doutor Henry Fok and Avenida Doutor Ma Man Kei. “These personalities were distinguished by their notable contributions to the reunification of Hong Kong and Macau and to the development of China, so the attribution of the name of the street to these personalities reflects the influence of political factors after the end of Macau's long colonial history and smooth reunification with China. The addition of the word ‘doctor’ to their names shows even more respect for them”, it reads. Also noteworthy is the existence of 140 streets in Macau whose names are translated phonetically from Chinese, highlighting Avenida de Ip Heng, Avenida de Lok Koi, Pátio de Iong Loc, Pátio Fu Van or Rua de San Lei. “All these words Chinese women express the people's desire for a better life and the search for quality of life. Other names are related to Chinese religion, such as Largo de Pao Cong Mio, Rua de Kun Iam Tong”, it is mentioned, without forgetting the 69 streets with names paraphrased in Chinese with connection to Chinese beliefs. “In order to live a better life and to forward it in the expected direction, the naming of the streets reflects geographical elements, as well as people's hopes for their future lives. The names of the streets are mentioned and used so often that people tend to give them good meanings to satisfy their own intentions of a better life. Influenced by traditional Chinese cultural concepts, many of the streets names in Macau have auspicious and lucky meanings, with the words 'harmony, tranquility, friendship, benevolence, concordia'. There are also streets whose names "show traders' desire to have a prosperous business and to get all the profits that come from business." In general terms, Zhao Zhen concludes that “Macau's experience proves the possibility of harmonious coexistence of various communities and cultures”, and the toponymy “reflects the coexistence and mix of the East and the West, the harmony and difference between them, which Today is a mirror of culture and fundamental values ​​of society. ”

item.title: USA | Trump takes office and throws barbs at China over Panama Canal
item.description: The new US President Donald Trump promised Monday to take control of the Panama Canal, renamed the Gulf of Mexico and reinforce the taxation of foreign countries, confirming intentions already expressed for the second term in the White House. In his speech at the inauguration ceremony as the 47th President of the United States, Donald Trump highlighted that the objective of the agreement and the spirit of the treaty in relation to the Panama Canal “have been completely violated”, promising to take control of this vital maritime infrastructure for global trade. “And most importantly, China operates the Panama Canal, and we didn’t give it to China, we gave it to Panama. And we’re going to take it back”, he explained in his speech held at the Capitol (headquarters of the North American Congress), in Washington. In another intention already expressed, Trump also confirmed that soon he will change the name of Mexico's Gulf to “Gulf of America”. More taxes Upon his return to the White House (North American presidency), after a first term between 2017 and 2021, the Republican politician also stated that he intends to reinforce taxation in foreign countries in favor of North American citizens. “I will immediately begin to reform our commercial system to protect families and US workers. Instead of taxing our citizens to enrich other countries, we will impose rates and taxes on foreign countries to enrich our citizens, ”he said. Expel illegal Donald Trump also assured that he will expel “millions and millions” of illegal immigrants, one of the main focuses of his election campaign. "First, I will declare the state of emergency in our southern border," with Mexico, said the president, adding that he will send the army to patrol this region. “All illegal entries will be immediately blocked and we will begin the process of returning millions and millions of criminal aliens to where they came,” added the Republican President. The oath of the new US leader was carried out shortly after his future vice-president, JD Vance, with which he led the republican party's appointment, which, on November 5, 2024, won the presidential election against the candidacy Democrat headed by Kamala Harris. The ceremony in Washington took place at 5 pm, Lisbon time (dawn in Macao) and was marked by the presence of populist and far-right international politicians, but with scarce government officials and without leaders of the European Union (EU), except the first -Menial Italian minister, Giorgia Meloni.

item.title: Oxfam | Report says that the fortunes of the richest will increase in 2024
item.description:
A report released yesterday by Oxfam indicates that the fortunes of the world's richest increased by two billion dollars last year, the equivalent of 5.7 billion dollars a day. The non-governmental organization suggests measures that promote equality and warns of the risks of concentration of wealth and power
It’s called “Takers not Makers – The unjust poverty and unearned wealth of colonialism” and is the most recent report from Oxfam, a non-governmental organization (NGO). ) which brings together 19 countries. The document draws attention to poverty in the world and inequalities in the distribution of wealth. The report released yesterday concludes that inequality shows no signs of slowing down. This is because, last year, the combined wealth of billionaires, globally, increased by two billion dollars, equivalent to 5.7 billion dollars per day, according to Oxfam. This means that it grew at a rate three times higher than the previous year, according to the NGO. This was the main conclusion of the report released yesterday at the beginning of the Davos World Economic Forum, which each year brings together the world's leading political and economic leaders in the Alpina city. In the last year alone, the report reports, an average of almost four new multimillionaires a week came, as Oxfam puts in contrast to the World Bank poverty data, which estimates that the number of people living with less than 6.85 Dollars a day has almost not changed since 1990. In 2024, there were 2,769 multimillionaires worldwide, instead of 2,565 the previous year, and its combined wealth increased from 13 to 15 billions of dollars in just 12 months. It is the second largest increase in the combined wealth of multimillionaires in a single year since there is a record. Another 100 million The joint wealth of the ten richest men in the world increased, on average, almost $ 100 million a day, the study indicates. Even if they lost 99 percent of their richness overnight, "they would remain multimillionaires." The NGO predicts that, in less than a decade, the first "billionaire" of the planet arises and does not exclude the possibility that there are at least five. Worldwide, the report reveals that 36 percent of the wealth of the richest is inherited and 61 percent is also marked by clientelism and/or linked to monopolistic power. Oxfam is based on Forbes magazine's 'wealth ranking' data, which show that all multimillionaires under 30 inherited their wealth and, according to Swiss bank UBS data, in the next 20 to 30 years, a thousand dos Current multimillionaires will leave their heirs more than $ 5.2 billion. Southern Money For Oxfam, the system "makes large flows of money from the global south to the north, benefit the richest population," in a kind of "modern colonialism." In 2023 alone, through the Financial System, $ 30 million will be removed per hour from the global southern countries to the richest 1 percent of the global northern countries, such as the United Kingdom, the United States and France. Thus, the “super rich” of the global northern countries control 69 percent of world wealth, concentrate 77 percent of the joint richness of all multimillionaires and represent about 68 percent of the total, although they constitute only 21 percent of World population. To contextualize this inequality, Oxfam refers to the problem of housing in Spain and estimates that "the five future billionaires on the planet will have so much money that they can buy all the country's houses." In contrast, attention is drawn to the fact that the “working class struggles to survive.” “Those living in poverty around the world continue to face multiple crises, as the scars of the pandemic are still with us in the form of unpayable debts, lower wages and much higher food prices.” Furthermore, “conflicts are also on the rise, which contributes to poverty, hunger and inequality”, without forgetting “the enormous human impact of climate degradation that increases every year, with deaths caused by excessive heat, extreme weather conditions and hunger". Oxfam even says that Donald Trump's re-election as President of the United States last November “gave a huge boost to billionaires' fortunes, while his policies are poised to further fan the flames of inequality”. The NGO also highlights the World Bank data in its latest poverty report, where it is said that "if the current growth rates remain and inequality does not decrease, it will take more than a century to end poverty." The document shows that "if we reduce inequality, poverty could be eliminated three times faster." One of the highlights is the contribution of women to the wealth of a few. “Racialized women living in poverty, especially those in the ‘Global South,’ continue to subsidize the global economy. It is estimated that every day women contribute 12.5 billion hours of unpaid work, adding at least $10.8 trillion in value to the global economy.” In this context, “the economic contribution of their care work is three times greater than the financial value of the global technology industry”. A new colonialism It is true that the decolonization of regions colonized by European powers began to occur with greater force after the Bandung Conference in 1955, but signs of power imbalance between people and countries persist, which explain, in part, the wealth inequality that occurs. today. The idea of ​​new colonialism, in the sense that regions such as Europe or North America continue to explore southern countries, especially the least developed, is well patent in the Oxfam report. “The rise of a new oligarchy in which inheritance, clientelism and monopoly power generate extreme wealth. Without control, we are about to see the greatest transfer of the greatest generational wealth in human history, hardly earned, hardly taxed. ” What is happening today is a panorama of “billionaire colonialism”, describes Oxfam, with “the transfer of wealth not only to the ultra-rich, but disproportionately to the ultra-rich in the Global North”. There is a “reckoning with colonialism not only as a history of brutal wealth extraction, but also as a powerful force driving extreme levels of inequality today.” Oxfam also draws attention to a new wave of colonialism evidence in the actions of the major economic and financial institutions that decide the direction of the global economy, such as the International Monetary Fund (IMF), the United Nations (UN) and the World Bank. "Global institutions, financial markets, and multinational companies, all shaped by colonialism and mastery of rich countries, continue to facilitate the south-north transfer of dollar trillion every year." For Oxfam, the UN, IMF and World Bank "were created 80 years ago, near the end of the historical colonial period, and its unequal governance has had little changed since then." “The G7 countries continue to hold 41 percent of the votes at the IMF and World Bank, despite having less than ten percent of the world's population. The leaders of the World Bank and IMF continue to be decided by the United States and Europe, respectively. Likewise, European countries and other nations in the Global North hold 47 percent of the total seats on the UN Security Council, despite representing only 17 percent of the world's population.” It should be noted that "the IMF and the World Bank continue to have a huge influence on the global economic system and, in particular, on the economic policies of low and medium-low countries." These entities, according to Oxfam, "systematically insist on the implementation of cuts in critical expenses." One of the examples presented is from the IMF, which “requires debtor countries to prioritize paying debts to creditors above all else and to implement policies that include privatization, trade liberalization and reduction of public deficits to obtain new loans”. “These policies undermine access to quality and affordable education and healthcare, with a negative impact on public health”, it adds. What to do? Oxfam proposes a series of measures to mitigate the growing inequality between the richest and the rest of the planet, suggesting, among others, that governments commit to ensuring that the yield of the ten percent of the population will not exceed the 40 Poor percent, both national and world level. The report also calls for an increase in taxes on large fortunes, through an international tax system designed by the UN, and the elimination of tax havens. With Lusa

item.title: Contests | Deputies discussed “competitive negotiation”
item.description: The possibility of representatives of the Public Administration to negotiate directly the proposals of public tenders with the candidates was discussed yesterday in the 1st Permanent Commission of the Legislative Assembly. This news will be created by the public hiring proposal, approved in general on January 11 last year. According to the explanations of Ella Lei, president of the commission, the possibility of so-called “competitive negotiation” with candidates is a new feature of the law, but can only be used in three situations: when all public tender proposals are rejected, although without changing substantially the tender specifications, when the work is too complex, making it impossible to establish a previous price for the proposals, or when the nature of the work makes it impossible to fix a price in advance. According to the newspaper or Mun, the law proposal states that when the administration chooses to avoid the public tender, and calls for proposals to a certain number of companies, the consultation must be made at least five companies. However, Ella Law indicated that the deputies are concerned that the alleged “randomness” of the companies consulted is not guaranteed or result in a fair procedure, so this will be discussed with the executive.

item.title: Press | Sam Hou Fai highlights diversity and internationalization
item.description:
The message was left by the chief executive during the dinner offered to the media in Portuguese and English. Sam Hou Fai highlighted the connecting link established with the international community
The Chief Executive, Sam Hou Fai, considered that the media in Portuguese and English play a role as a link with the international community. The message was left during the traditional dinner offered to the media. According to the Social Communication Office, Sam Hou Fai stated that “Portuguese and English language media is an important example of Macao's cultural diversity and internationalization”. The government leader said they hoped these bodies “also proceed with the good performance of the international link, enhancing the advantages of linguistic, cultural and international ties, continuing to exterior to Macao's uniqueness, resulting from the fusion of oriental and western cultures. ”. With this hope, the government leader believes that the media bodies contribute to "raising the role of Macao as a platform between China and Portuguese -speaking countries, as well as a higher -level opening platform." The Chief Executive also stated that he hopes that “the sector will continue to increase its development and promote, together with the Government, internationalization, so that Macau is more attractive and has greater global influence”. As such, Sam Hou Fai hopes that they will transmit “abroad, through professional reporting, the 'Macao experiences' and the 'wisdom of China', favoring better clarification and avoiding misunderstandings and misinterpretations from abroad, thus making the MSAR in an important window of objective, rational and genuine exchange of Eastern and Western cultures”. Protected freedoms In the hopes of addresses at dinner with representatives of the media, Sam also requested inspection “to the government action”. Given the year 2024, Sam Hou Fai made a positive balance of the action of the media, indicating that “they performed the important function of link with the Portuguese and English communities abroad in accessing information about Macau”. In addition, he indicated that they took advantage of “well the unique advantages of the region, resulting from the proximity to the interior of China and its opening to the world” and made “know the reality and development of Macao and provide first -hand information to the public about the public Successful implementation of the principle a country, two systems. ” The government leader also indicated that “freedom of the press is totally secured by the basic law and the Press Law of the MSAR, so it will be safeguarded, as always and under the law, by the Government of the MSAR, which will support the Sector in correct compliance with their duties, news coverage and access to news, actively collaborating in the efficient exchange of information between the various public services and the sector. ”

item.title: Continental Council of Affairs warns "possible risks" in Macau
item.description: Taiwan has advised people not to travel to Hong Kong or Macau during the Lunar New Year period, due to “possible security risks”. Taiwan's Continental Affairs Council (MAC) recalled that the travel alert for the two territories remains at “orange level”, the second highest level. The agency responsible for relations with China justifies the warning "taking into account the changes to the situation in Hong Kong and Macau and in response to local laws and regulations and methods of application of laws." "Citizens are advised to avoid non -essential trips" to both cities, including in transit, due to "possible risks to safety and individual rights," added the MAC in a statement. Lunar New Year is the main festival for Chinese families, equivalent to Christmas in Western countries, and this year in Taiwan it includes a period of nine days of holidays between January 25th and February 2nd. The MAC advised the population to register, in advance, in a database created for Taiwanese traveling to the Interior, Hong Kong or Macau and recalled that there are hotlines to support citizens. Records rising Although not mandatory, the number of Taiwanese who registered to travel to Chinese territory between January and October 2024 increased by around 14 times compared to the previous year, according to data released by the organization in December. Registrations for Hong Kong and Macau “exceeded five times the total for the same period last year”, said the MAC. China "continued to adopt and change national security laws, which led to several incidents, involving arbitrary detention, arrest and interrogation of Taiwanese citizens in mainland China, Hong Kong and Macao," said the body. In September, MAC said that a director of the Taiwanese conglomerate Formosa Plastics had been under “border control” for 18 days, a type of measure that prevents him from leaving the country. Taiwan raised in mid -June the travel alert level and advised the population to avoid China, Hong Kong and Macau, after Beijing threatened to execute people considered “defendant turns” of Taiwanese independence.

item.title: Financial reserve | Close to the best annual record since the pandemic
item.description:
After the years of the pandemic, the Macao SAR's financial reserve is close to recording its best year, with gains of 37.5 billion patacas in the first 11 months of the year
The Macao Financial Reserve is close to registering the best year since the pandemic, after earning 37.5 billion patacas in the first 11 months of 2024, was announced yesterday. According to data from the Monetary Authority of Macau (AMCM), this could be the highest annual increase since 2019, when the value of the reserve increased by 70.6 billion patacas. The MSAR financial reserve earned 22.2 billion patacas by 2023, after losing almost four times this value in the previous year. The value of the reserve amounted to almost 618 billion patacas at the end of November, the highest value since March 2022, according to data published in the Official Bulletin. Still, the value remains far from the record of 663.6 billion patacas reached in February 2021, in the midst of the Covid-19 pandemic. The territory's financial reserve gained 4.63 billion patacas in November, compared to October, the month in which it suffered the second drop in 2024. The value of the extraordinary reserve at the end of November was 431.9 billion patacas and the basic reserve, equivalent to 150 percent of Macau's public budget for this year, was 153.4 billion patacas. Budget foresaw surplus The budget for 2024 predicted a 1.4 percent increase in total expenditure, to 105.9 billion patacas. The financial reserve is mainly made up of deposits and current accounts worth 243.2 billion patacas, credit securities worth 121.6 billion patacas and up to 247.1 billion patacas in subcontracted investments. In January 2024, AMCM stressed that investments surrendered to the financial reserve nearly 29 billion patacas by 2023, corresponding to a profitability rate of 5.2 percent. This is despite the fact that, in 2023, the region's authorities transferred almost 10.4 billion patacas from the financial reserve to the public budget. Macau's budget for 2024 predicted the return of surpluses in public accounts, anticipating a positive balance of 1.17 billion patacas, without “the need to resort to the financial reserve”.

item.title: Obligations | Direct link created with Hong Kong
item.description: The Macau Monetary and Exchange Authority (AMCM) joined its counterpart Hong Kong Monetary Authority (HKMA) to create a service connecting Macau to the neighboring region's stock exchange. This is the “Central Moneymarkets Unit” (CMU) which will be operated by “CMU OmniClear Limited”, a subsidiary company 100 percent owned by the “Exchange Fund of Hong Kong” and the Macau Securities Depository Central, operated by the Macau Securities Deposit and Settlement Center – Sociedade Unipessoal Limitada. This entity is wholly owned by AMCM. The objective of creating the CMU is “to promote the integrated development of bond markets in the two regions”. This project will, according to an official note from AMCM, “provide a cross-border channel for financing and investment, allowing investors from both regions to participate more conveniently and efficiently in the bond markets of both parties”.
